Title: A Custom Trust Policy Is Used If Your Application Needs Additional Permissions
DirectLink: A Custom Trust Policy Is Used If Your Application Needs Additional Permissions

Data:
What to Check For

Check to ensure that a custom trust policy file is created if your application requires additional permissions beyond those provided at a particular trust level, and it does not need the additional permissions provided by the next trust level.

Why

To avoid granting your application unnecessary permissions.

How to Fix

To create a custom policy, copy the trust level policy file that most closely matches your application's permission requirements to create a new custom policy file. Locate this file in the standard policy file directory, which is %Windir%\Microsoft.NET\Framework\{Version}\CONFIG. Then add the required additional permissions to the custom policy file and configure your application to run using the custom policy.

Adapted from Microsoft patterns & practices guidance.
